page.title: 01THE THAMES VALLEY
page.content: This section of the Thames Valley consists of flood plains rising to mixed woodland.In an area of outstanding beauty it contains the river side villages of Hurley and Medmenham.Both villages were mentioned in the Domesday Book. Three of the large historic houses in the area are now used as offices. Land previously used for farming is now used for recreational pursuits -pheasant shooting, horse riding and caravanning. Farming is to a large extent now in the hands of farming syndicates.Dairy produce is very common. There is much evidence of a wide variety of wild life.
